title: Women of ars: are you tending to your incubator?
description: I've been stewing over this article for a couple of days, I don't think it was ever posted here.Forever Pregnant From the article: quote: New federal guidelines ask all females capable of conceiving a baby to treat themselves -- and to be treated by the health care system -- as pre-pregnant...
cleaned_text:
I've been stewing over this article for a couple of days, I don't think it was ever posted here.

quote:
New federal guidelines ask all females capable of conceiving a baby to treat themselves -- and to be treated by the health care system -- as pre-pregnant, regardless of whether they plan to get pregnant anytime soon.

Among other things, this means all women between first menstrual period and menopause should take folic acid supplements, refrain from smoking, maintain a healthy weight and keep chronic conditions such as asthma and diabetes under control.


Later in the article it talks about the dangers of drinking alcohol as well. I don't really think I can come up with words for how compelely Big Brother insane this whole thing is to me. I am angry. I don't want my daughter having health care providers treating her like a baby pod from her first period on. I don't want to be told what I should and shouldn't be doing once I'm DONE having children - I don't care if I'm still physically capable of becoming pregnant or not. I have willingly spent two years of my life following the recommendations put out by doctors for things that pregnant women should and should not do...I am absolutely unwilling to live that way when I am not pregnant nor am I trying to concieve.

Besides taking folic acid supplements daily (WTF? ummm, no), I think you'd be surprised what else pregnant women are not supposed to do.

No eating:
deli meats
hot dogs
sausages
unpasturized cheese/milk/juice/anything
raw fish (goodbye sushi)
raw beef (goodbye even medium rare - hell, probably medium too, I don't even want to know)
sprouts
swordfish, shark, king mackeral, or tilefish (mercury content)
tuna (mercury content)
raw eggs (no mousse or tiramisu or cookie dough or brownie batter)
artificial sweetners
MSG's
more OTC and prescription meds than I care to list
alcohol
Optional: people with a family history of allergies are also encouraged not to eat highly allergenic foods (dairy, treenuts/peanuts, I dunno, probably a bunch of other things)
Also: you can eat junkfood, fastfood, treats, sweets, partially hydrogenated oils, etc, but it makes you a bad person.

No lifting anything over 25 lbs
No changing cat litter
No using useful chemicals of any sort (paint thinner, wood finish stripping stuff, oil based paint, really anything that says it should be used in a well-ventilated area)

That's all I can think of offhand. I'm sure I could come up with a lot more if I tried.

quote:
Research shows that "during first few weeks (before 52 days' gestation) of pregnancy" -- during which a woman may not yet realize she's pregnant -- "exposure to alcohol, tobacco and other drugs; lack of essential vitamins (e.g., folic acid); and workplace hazards can adversely affect fetal development and result in pregnancy complications and poor outcomes for both the mother and the infant," the report states.


Workplace hazards? Wait, so if my job isn't pregnancy friendly, I shouldn't be able to have it between the onset of menstruation and the end of menopause? Seriously, what the holy hell. What about all of the medications that are not for women who are pregnant or planning on becoming pregnant? Will all women of childbearing age be denied these medications just in case they accidentally get pregnant?

The implications of having an official policy that treats all women like mere breeders is just too much for me to try to process. My head assplode. This is right up there with women being forced to have abdominal surgery against their will because clearly fetuses should have more rights than their incubators.
